content: This Student Handbook covers the policies, rules and regulations of PLMun...

subsections.content: Initiated by Mayor Ignacio Bunye in 1986, MPC was created in 1991.
Converted into Pamantasan ng Lungsod ng Muntinlupa in 2003 via City Ordinance No. 03-089.
Rapid expansion led to new buildings, CHED recognition, and scholarship ordinances.
List of presidents and deans from 1991 to present.
Symbolizes enlightenment through education.
Represents resiliency and endurance of students.
Represents nine barangays of Muntinlupa.
Signifies national identity and nation-building.
Official color is bamboo green.
Promotes intellectual growth, leadership, professionalism, and global competitiveness.
A dynamic and highly competitive HEI committed to people empowerment.
Provide quality, affordable, and relevant education responsive to local and global needs.
Global harmony, ethical professionals, research, equitable access to learning.
Righteousness, Pride, Ownership, Urgency, Excellence.
Governing body chaired by the Mayor.
Chief Executive Officer of the University.
Supervises teaching personnel and academic programs.
Supervises administrative personnel.
Handles budget, finance, and procurement.
Safekeeping and releasing of funds.
Supervise teaching personnel and co-curricular activities.
Keeps student records and enrollment procedures.
Supervises library operations.
Maintains peace, order, and safety.
Investigates disciplinary cases.
Oversees scholarships, guidance, career placement, cultural affairs, sports, student orgs, publications, health services, and community involvement.
MBA, MAEd (Educational Management, Guidance & Counseling), Master in Security and Correctional Administration.
BA Mass Communication, BA Political Science, BS Psychology.
BSBA (HRDM, Marketing, Operations), BS Accountancy.
BS Criminology.
BS Computer Science, BS IT, Associate in Computer Technology.
BEEd (General, ECED, SPED), BSEd (Biological Science, English, Filipino, Math, Social Science, MAPEH).

keyword: Admission Requirements and Procedure of Enrollment

subsections.content: Form 137/138, Barangay clearance, voter’s ID, birth certificate, photos, exam, interview.
Similar to froshies but clearance and voter’s ID optional.
Clearance form, advising, cashier payment, COM.
Visa, acceptance letter, affidavit of support, passport, birth certificate, English proficiency test, CHED permit, ACR/ICR.
TOR with GPA ≥ 85%, 18 units Education (if non-education graduate), teaching experience, entrance exam, interview.
Submit Good Moral Certificate, Birth Certificate, Form 137/138, Drug Test, Barangay Clearance, voter’s ID, photos, medical exam.
Pre-enrollment slip, advising, cashier payment, COM.
TOR, Honorable Dismissal, student number, advising, cashier payment, COM.
Allowed only during enrollment period.
Allowed within two weeks after start of classes.
Allowed three weeks after opening of classes up to one week before midterm.
May add six more units to regular load.
Maximum of 9 units for graduating students; also for repeaters, cross-enrollees, and those on leave.

keyword: Withdrawal, Adding and Dropping of a Subject

subsections.content: Requires official approval; otherwise failing grade.
Maximum of two subjects per semester.
Requires dean approval and registrar recording.
Allowed only if curriculum changes.
Carries full academic load.
Carries less than full academic load.
Reduced load due to employment.
10 working days after encoding.
70% within first week, 50% within second week.
Ordinance No. 98-008 provides scholarships for indigent students.
Ordinance No. 13-010 increased financial incentives.
Required for all classes.
May result in failure or disciplinary action.
Students must meet GPA and subject requirements to continue enrollment.
Failure to meet retention requirements may lead to dismissal.

keyword: Leave of Absence (LOA) and Honorable Dismissal

subsections.content: Students may file for LOA with proper documentation.
Requires clearance from the Registrar.
Scheduled per academic calendar.
Incomplete grades must be removed within one year.
Complete prescribed units, pass all subjects, meet GPA requirements.
Based on academic excellence and GPA thresholds.
Given for leadership, service, and special achievements.
Warnings or reprimands for small violations.
Suspension or dismissal for serious violations.
CODI investigates, results forwarded to President for action.

keyword: Prefect of Discipline, Complaints and Grievances

subsections.content: Implements rules and regulations governing student behavior.
Students may file complaints through proper channels.
Handled fairly with investigation and resolution.
Provides books, multimedia, and research materials.
University Librarian manages operations and improvements.
Primary healthcare and wellness programs.
Monitoring of safe and healthful food.
Programs for physical fitness and wellness.
Activities for appreciation and preservation of culture.
Provision of safe and secure environment.
Right to quality education, freedom of expression, participation in governance.
Respect rules, uphold integrity, attend classes.
Contribute to community, maintain discipline, protect university property.
Organizations must be recognized by OSA.
Represents the student body officially.

keyword: Policies and Guidelines of the Student Publication

subsections.content: Upholds freedom of expression within bounds of University mission.
Enhances student writing and journalism skills.
Athletic programs for fitness and competition.
Cultural events and performances.
Projects for shared responsibility.

keyword: Collection of Fees and Fund Raising Activities

subsections.content: Must be approved by the University.
Follows official guidelines.

keyword: National Anthem, Panunumpa sa Watawat, Muntinlupa March, PLMun Hymn

subsections.content: Students must participate in singing the national anthem.
Students pledge allegiance to the flag.
Official city anthem.
University hymn sung at official events.

content: Additional policies and guidelines may be issued by the Board of Regents.
Students pledge allegiance to the University, committing to uphold its vision, mission, and values.
